Reference to enquiry from Persian Legation for two or three cargo vessels. Understand new vessels of 6,000 to 7,000 tons are required either already built or to be built to order and should be able to carry some passengers. Persian government are vague as to specifications. Could you inform me for communication to Minister of Finance names of two or three impartial British shipping experts who could advise Persian government or Legation as to type of ships specifications etc. How long would building of such ships take after placing of order.DEPARTMENT of overseas trade^ Foreign Office and Board of Trade. Sir, I beg to Inform you that I have received Instructions from the Persian Government to Invite ship-building firms in this country to tender for the supply of three oil burning cargo steamers of 6,000 to 7,000 tons for service in tropical waters. They must necessarily be of the most modern design, comprising the most up-to-date accommodation, and be specially adapted to withstand the heat in the Persian Gulf. I should be grateful if you would be good enough to bring this request to the notice of suitable firms in the United Kingdom, with a view to their submitting tenders for these three steamers, to be forwarded by this Legation to the Persian Government. Tenders should be in duplicate and contain a detailed description of the steamers tendered for, together with prices and terms of payment, and the time construction and delivery to Bushire on the Persian Gulf would take. Yours faithfully, (Sgd) F. NOURY ESFANDIARY, Persian Charge d 1 Affaires. The Comptroller-General of the Department of Overseas Trade, 35, Old Queen Street, S.W.l.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description (used for referencing) commences at f 17, and terminates at f 40, as it is part of a larger physical volume; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file contains papers regarding a request by the Government of Persia for tenders from shipbuilding firms for three new cargo steamers. The primary correspondents are: Persian Chargé d'Affaires, London; Department of Overseas Trade; Commercial Secretary, British Legation, Tehran; Foreign Office.
